alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Coal; Johnston; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 11 at 5:28AM CDT until July 11 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 AM CDT FOR EASTERN JOHNSTON...BRYAN...SOUTHWESTERN COAL...NORTHEASTERN MARSHALL AND SOUTHWESTERN ATOKA COUNTIES... At 528 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Wapanucka to 4 miles southeast of Fillmore to 4 miles northwest of Mead, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Durant, Atoka, Caddo, Bokchito, Wapanucka, Bennington, Silo, Milburn, Tushka, Caney, Kenefic, Bromide, Mead, Armstrong, Blue, Lane, Fillmore, Coleman, Little City, and Nida. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
